cards.title: KatyaFlix
cards.description: To organize my personal (legally owned) media collection, I created a system to keep track of my lists and watchtimes. Is currently hosted locally on my personal Debian server, and is accessible only on my private network. Currently, file uploads and encodings are done through a custom Bash script on the server. Am working on transferring queing logic to Node.js.

listItems.paragraph: Designed and developed a fully integrated, self hosted movie streaming platform.
Backend implemented in Node.js with Express, providing RESTful APIs for media retrieval, playback, and watch history tracking.
Integrated FFmpeg into the upload workflow for media and subitle encoding (to support viewing on all browsers), managed through a Bash automation script.
Created an aesthetically pleasing frontend with React (Typescript), and SCSS. Used The Movie DataBase API (TMDB) to source media covers, descriptions, posters, and more.
Reverse proxied API requests, and hosted media through Nginx on Debian server.
PostgreSQL relational database hosted on Debian server supports per profile watchtimes/watchlists as well as normalized tables mapping media serving locations.
All services containerized with Docker for simplified deployment and maintenance.

cards.title: SALLY API
cards.description: Designed and created from the ground up during my co-op term at Mackenzie Health. Secure .NET backend API tool hosted via IIS, centralizing data access, user authentication, reporting, emailing, and user/profile management of over 10,000 employees across 5 services. Fills the gap between lacking third party software from previous contractors and expedites in house app developments.

listItems.paragraph: Designed and implemented reusable services for SQL access, Active Directory (AD) operations, and web app communication using dependency injection and singleton/hosted service patterns.
Designed and implemented the entire relational database schema for SALLY.
Built a CRON based (Quartz library) scheduler for automated emails, notifcations, and report generation.
Reverse engineered external contractor APIs. Mimicked undocumented HTTP workflows and implemented wrappers within SALLY to ensure system continuity.
Abstracted and integrated web service operations using interfaces and disposable operation factories to ensure clean, scalable code.
Created and maintained internal use endpoints for bulk cleanup and data migration operations across production systems.
Set up comprehensive logging via GlobalLogger with daily rollover.

cards.title: Badgeify
cards.description: Developed during my co-op term at Mackenzie Health. Workflow automation tool to expedite the employee badge issuance process for the Security department, which is a critical task. Previously a manual, error prone task performed across two separate web UIs, Badgeify integrates with Active Directory to use employee profiles as the source of truth. It automatically maps the correct fields to two external contractor services, eliminating spelling mistakes and misassignments. To date, it has successfully expedited, consolidated, and updated over 1,500 employee badges. Utilizes SALLY API.

listItems.paragraph: Designed a relational database to map over 10,000 employees to their correct roles, departments, and managers across three integrated services.
Built a queue and semaphore system to support concurrent users while preventing data races and conflicting updates on the same user record.
Implemented security roles using Active Directory for access control, with JWT authentication for user authorization. Secured calls to the backend through front end and back end validation.
Developed a responsive and user friendly web interface using ASP.NET, Bootstrap, and custom CSS, featuring client side validation, detailed admin logs, and error handling.
Optimized backend performance by minimizing API calls through techniques like input debouncing during searches.
Provided ongoing maintenance and support for the application, addressing bug reports promptly and reliably throughout the appâ€™s lifecycle.

cards.title: Handsify
cards.description: Created during my co-op term at Mackenzie Health to manage over 10,000 smart hand sanitizer sensors acrosss the hospital. Handsify provides a visual dashboard to streamline sensor maintenance and tracking. Began development of a machine learning model to predict maintenance needs, reducing manual inspection time and saving an estimated 7+ hours of monthly on floor maintenance. Utilizes SALLY API.

listItems.paragraph: Implemented security roles using Active Directory for access control, with JWT authentication for user authorization. Secured calls to the backend through front end and back end validation.
Developed a responsive and user friendly web interface using ASP.NET, Bootstrap, and custom CSS, featuring client side validation, detailed admin logs, and error handling.
Built an interactive map using JS canvas element and user events.

cards.title: Personal Website
cards.description: Super meta - this is the website you're on right now. I'm constantly fixing it up and adding new stuff. It's mobile friendly!

cards.title: Pawfect Pairs
cards.description: Pawfect Pairs is designed to help prospective pet owners find their perfect match; users set personal preferences and apply filters, and are scored with the best potential matches. The platform also features a user-pet meetup scheduler, as well as a donation/sponsorship system (one time or recurring). Took a leading role in this project for my Software Development Project course (EECS 2311).

listItems.paragraph: Utilized Java and Gradle to build a scalable backend infrastructure and implemented efficient sorting and matching algorithms to handle a PostgreSQL database with over 10,000 dogs, each tagged with unique attributes.
Designed and created an appealing and intuitive front end user interface using CSS and JavaFX to support a responsive and user friendly experience.

Conducted thorough testing with JUnit 5 unit tests and comprehensive end-to-end test analysis on the login page creating detailed test cases, bug reports, identifying security threats such as SQL injections, and resolving bugs.

cards.title: Dockerized Minecraft Server
cards.description: I wanted to manage multiple modded Minecraft servers easily on my Debian server and be able to ship my solution to anyone. Private VPN hosted via Wireguard & Docker. Supports the management of multiple modded Minecraft servers deployed in Docker containers. Step by step guide on how to setup on my Github coming soon...

cards.title: Digtial Safe
cards.description: Built and programmed a prototyped digital safe using a DE10-Lite FPGA board. For my Digital Logic Design (EECS 3201) course.

cards.title: Balloono
cards.description: In this competitive multiplayer game, similar to Bomberman, players blast through the map with balloons, collect powerups, and defeat opponents, earning currency ('shallots') to purchase cosmetic items in the shop. Supports user account creation, and randomly generated maps. Uses Firebase Realtime database for multiplayer experience.

cards.title: Medicine Tracker
cards.description: Prototyped a medicine tracker to help patients or healthcare managers input weekly medication schedules, receive reminders, and mark off medications as they're taken. Developed as an optional final project in the introductory object oriented programming course, addressing the need for enhanced medical management. Made with Arduino and Java (firmata4j library).

cards.title: Vampire Hunt Game
cards.description: 10th grade culminating computer science project. Retro style, edge scrolling game. Created with Python and Pygame.
